intro: Aeschynomene venezolana, commonly known as the Venezuelan horsegram, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to South America, particularly Venezuela, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in racemes, followed by elongated, cylindrical pods containing small, dark seeds. Aeschynomene venezolana is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in tropical and subtropical regions. It is also valued for its potential as a forage crop and for its nitrogen-fixing ability, which enriches the soil.
